docs.snippet: The Inaugural Address for his second term makes a forceful argument for a progressive agenda....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Inaugural Address for his second term makes a forceful argument for a progressive agenda.
docs.abstract: Editorial praises Pres Obama's second Inaugural Address, which makes forceful argument for progressive agenda; expresses hope that he has political will and tactical instincts to carry it out.

headline.seo: President Obama Begins His Second Term

docs.snippet: The one place that many Republicans say they will not be during the long weekend, if they can help it, is anywhere near the nation’s capital....
docs.lead_paragraph: The one place that many Republicans say they will not be during the long weekend, if they can help it, is anywhere near the nation’s capital.
docs.abstract: Many Republicans are planning to leave Washington, DC, during Pres Obama's inauguration weekend; say that decision is not born out of animosity, but instead concern over security and huge crowds as hundreds of thousands of Americans descend upon nation's capital for inaugural festivities.

headline.seo: As Washington Draws Inaugural Crowds, Republicans Leave
headline.main: As Droves Flock to Washington, Republicans Find Reasons to Leave
headline.print_headline: As Droves Flock to Washington, Republicans Find Reasons to Leave

docs.snippet: Because same-sex marriages are not recognized by the military, gay service members who are married are barred from receiving benefits accorded to heterosexual married couples....
docs.lead_paragraph: Because same-sex marriages are not recognized by the military, gay service members who are married are barred from receiving benefits accorded to heterosexual married couples.
docs.abstract: Many gay and bisexual service members say that because same-sex marriages are not recognized by military, they are barred from receiving benefits accorded to heterosexual married couples; are beginning to prod lawmakers and military leaders to change status quo, now that they are allowed to serve openly.

headline.seo: Gay Spouses Face a Fight for Acceptance in the Military
headline.main: Military Rules Leave Gay Spouses Out in Cold
headline.print_headline: Military Rules Leave Gay Spouses Out in Cold

docs.snippet: President Obama will formally unveil his plans for reducing gun violence at a White House event Wednesday....
docs.abstract: President Obama will formally unveil his plans for reducing gun violence at a White House event Wednesday.

headline.main: Obama Set to Announce Plans to Address Gun Violence

docs.snippet: The Obama inaugural committee is struggling to enlist corporate donors to help toward its $50 million goal....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama inaugural committee is struggling to enlist corporate donors to help toward its $50 million goal.
docs.abstract: Pres Obama’s inaugural committee is at least $10 million short of its $50 million fund-raising goal; committee is struggling to bring in corporate money after Obama's announcement that he would accept contributions from businesses.

headline.main: Fund-Raising Is Lagging, So Far, for Inaugural Plans
headline.print_headline: Fund-Raising Is Lagging, So Far, for Inaugural Plans

docs.snippet: The president has a plausible way to work around the nation’s borrowing limit. The sooner Congress knows that, the better....
docs.lead_paragraph: The president has a plausible way to work around the nation’s borrowing limit. The sooner Congress knows that, the better.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by law Prof Edward D Kleinbard proposes that Pres Obama should threaten to issue IOU's if Congress refuses to raise country's borrowing limit; contends that such option would be least painful way to defang most extortionate demands of Congressional hardliners.

headline.seo: An Escape Hatch for the Debt Ceiling

docs.snippet: Can Michelle Obama, who has used celebrity and style to redefine her role as first lady, step off the glamour pedestal and broaden her reach?...
docs.lead_paragraph: Can Michelle Obama, who has used celebrity and style to redefine her role as first lady, step off the glamour pedestal and broaden her reach?
docs.abstract: Many people hope that Michelle Obama, who has used celebrity and style to redefine her role as first lady, can step off the glamour pedestal in her next four years in the White House and broaden the reach of her powerful voice, on issues that are more controversial, like educational reform and work-life balance.

docs.snippet: President Obama returned to the White House on Thursday to resume efforts to end a partisan fiscal impasse with the family dog, Bo....
docs.abstract: President Obama returned to the White House on Thursday to resume efforts to end a partisan fiscal impasse with the family dog, Bo.

headline.main: Obama Returns to Washington, With Bo

docs.snippet: Can the kind of empathy driving a new push on gun control carry over to climate change?...
docs.abstract: Can the kind of empathy driving a new push on gun control carry over to climate change?

headline.main: Empathy as a Path to Climate (and Energy) Progress

docs.snippet: When it comes to dealing with the country’s economic problems, Americans give President Obama the upper hand, according to a national poll released Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: When it comes to dealing with the country’s economic problems, Americans give President Obama the upper hand, according to a national poll released Friday. Nearly half, 48 percent, said they trust Mr. Obama more to develop solutions to the nation’s economic problems, compared with the 32 percent who trust Congressional Republicans more.
docs.abstract: When it comes to dealing with the country’s economic problems, Americans give President Obama the upper hand, according to a national poll released Friday.
